newsitem.title: JAPAN: Hitachi unscathed by forecast revision.
newsitem.headline: Hitachi unscathed by forecast revision.

text.p: Shares in Hitachi Ltd were unchanged at midday on Monday as belief that a worldwide semiconductor glut is nearing an end offset the effects of the firm's downward revision of its earnings forecast, brokers said.
By midday, the shares had edged back up to 1,070 yen after shedding about 10 yen early in the morning. Trade volume was 1.101 million shares.
Shares in NEC rose 10 yen to 1,250 yen, propelled by the optimism about semiconductors. It had the fourth-largest trade volume at 1.515 million shares,

On Friday, Hitachi revised down its parent current profit forecast for the year to March 31, 1997, to 70 billion yen from a previous forecast of 110 billion yen. The previous fiscal year it reported an actual parent current profit of 128.81 billion yen.
